intro: Brocchia cinerea, commonly known as the gray brocchia, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Europe and North Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges or along stream banks. Brocchia cinerea is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used historically in herbal medicine.
